item.title: Vincente Huidobro - Elegy for the Death of Lenin
item.description: [Elegia para la muerte de Lenin] Greater than the song of life greater than death itself greater than the pain of memory greater than the anguish of time is your presence in the soul of the world. You, heights-scaling man You, heart of tamed fires entering the tomb you were like a sudden sun in winter you were like a summer in death with you, death becomes greater than life.

item.title: Ernesto Cardenal - Midnight Office
item.description: [Oficio Nocturno] 2 AM. It is the hour of the Midnight Office, and in shadow the church seems full of demons. This is the hour of darkness and parties. The hour of my binges. And my past returns. “And my sin is always before me” And while we recite the psalms, my memories interfere with prayer like radios and jukeboxes. Old movie scenes come back, nightmares, hours alone in hotels, dances, journeys, kisses, bars.

item.title: LOS KGFC - My Brother's Girlfriend
item.description: [La Novia de Mi Hermano] Surprising her while she dyes her hair is worse than walkng in when she’s in the shower. She walks between cars listening to Selena on her walkman. She has a jean jacket with cigarettes in its seven pockets. My black tees make her laugh and she takes me by the arm at parties. She walks between cars smiling for a camera only she can see.

item.title: Roque Dalton - Poem XVI
item.description: [Poema XVI] The laws are made for the poor to follow. The laws are made by the rich to give a little order to exploitation. The poor are the only followers of the laws of history. When the poor make the laws the rich will be no more.
